snippet: The state is proposing broad changes in the way it protects underground water from oil and gas operations, after finding 2,500 instances in which the state authorized such operations in protected water aquifers.
abstract: California oil and gas regulators release proposal sent to Environmental Protection Agency that would change how state protects underground water from oil and gas operations; proposal was crafted after state and federal review found 2,500 instances of state authorizing such operations in protected water aquifers.
lead_paragraph: The state is proposing broad changes in the way it protects underground water from oil and gas operations, after finding 2,500 instances in which the state authorized such operations in protected water aquifers.

headline.main: California: Water Safety Plan Sent to E.P.A.
headline.print_headline: California: Water Safety Plan Sent to E.P.A.
